Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: LadyBulldog7
Reviews.Content: For starters, the wifi here is horrible. The connection kept going down, the signal was nil in some parts of my room, it could slow to a crawl, and it didn't even work on my last day there. However, what I really need to warn about here is that the third night there, I woke up coughing from cigarette smoke or something coming from my bathroom vent. I changed rooms the next day and it seemed to go away. Also, the water seems to have black specks in it (handyman websites seem to suggest sediment buildup or something). If you value your health, you don't stay here. I'm also going to be in touch with public health about this. I really wish in retrospect that I checked out reviews of this place before I went.

Reviews.Title: “Layover in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I had a 14 hour layover in Vancouver before leaving for overseas. This hotel has a courtesy phone in the airport to arrange for the free shuttle service. The hotel rate was reasonable.This hotel let me check in on my early arrival at 9 am. It also offers a complimentary breakfast. I think the hotel needs some renovations and updating otherwise it served my reason for staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Alert!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trixie726
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here I was covered in bed bugs after 1 night in this hotel. My bad luck obviously but better housekeeping could have prevented it.

Reviews.Title: “It's Cheap...”
Reviews.Author: Wayne R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of times last spring. It's cheep, I'll give it that. However, the front desk staff are totally indifferent and completely useless. The rooms were OK and clean but the whole place is just tired. There is a funky, poorly lit hallway (not accessible - stairs) that leads to the scruffy looking parking garage. Upon checking in, there was a women at the front desk with a complaint and she was exasperated and asking to talk to the manager. (Bad sign number one.) I could hear him on the phone with the front desk clerk in his office, just behind the front desk. He was too chicken sh*t to come out and talk to her. On my last, and very likely LAST, stay I was trying to get down from the 5th floor to check out and both elevators stopped working. After waiting for 15 to 20 minutes I went back to my room and called the front desk. He said that one of the elevators wasn't working but the other one was. I told him that I could tell from listening that neither was working. "Oh, well I don't know what to tell you." Really! That's your best response to a customer who is trapped in your building?! I finally asked if I should just go down the stairs and set off the fire alarms by doing so. He just said "I guess so..." Absolutely bloody useless! I shudder to think of how they would handle a true emergency. Anyway, I went to collect my bags and head down five floors of stairs. Just as I collected everything up, the elevator door opened. I hesitated for a second then decided to just go for it. Luckily, everything worked out OK. The lobby looks like a 1980's disco. It's just missing some drag queens and a mirror ball to at least make it camp. As it is, it's just tired like the rest of the place. I am not at all likely to stay there again. I gave them two tries and they were just as bad both times.

Reviews.Title: “Type of room different with what I have booked”
Reviews.Author: secretguess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Super 8 vancouver and booked it with mileages from continental airlines 2,5 months before the date. I choose 1 bed (i travelled with spouse) when I booked and got email booking confirmation the I will got 1 bed standard. When I checked in at the hotel, However, The front desk gave us the double bed and we gave the print out of email confirmation about the room type etc (that it confirmend for the queen bed). He kept insisted that they only gave based on what in the system. and they could not do anything aout that. That is strange because it never happened before in other hotels. Also the wifi internet was terrible. It kept down especially when weconnected from our room. And they don't have friendly front desks (but good clean room service staffs though)

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: AEF304
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with my reservation, and both the General Manager and one of the front desk employees were extremely rude. I couldn't finish describing my problem before they interrupted and talked over me. The General Manager said he would look into the problem and call me back, but he never did, so I called back. Rather than addressing the problem or even telling me what he had learned when looking into it, he hung up on me. Don't walk -- Run! away from this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Creepy.”
Reviews.Author: BeckieC23
Reviews.Content: By far, the creepiest motel I've ever stayed at. My friends and I only stayed one night and I wish we hadn't. The sliding glass door in our room wouldn't lock and there were people walking outside of the door late at night. Every time we went up to our room there was a new bad smell. There were weird, abandoned floors that you'd walk by that were dirty and totally empty. It was like something out of a horror movie.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: BeagleWestKootenay
Reviews.Content: We stay at a number or Super 8, when we travel, but this one we only stayed one night, asked for a non smoking room. They put us in a room that smelled terrible from people smoking in it. The curtains fell off the curtain rod when we went to open the patio door. The door looked like it had not been cleaned in ages, finger prints and cob webs on the door. The bed was on a slope as both the bed legs at the top of the bed had been broken off. We were given another room. We were woken up in the middle of the night as some man was coming into our room. We called the front desk and the lady said oh we didn't know you had changed rooms. Upon check out the lady at the front desk would not even listen to us, she just turned around and walked away when we were telling her that we were not happy about someone coming into our room when we were sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value secured free parking, free breakfast, and they allow pets”
Reviews.Author: Bandlor
Reviews.Content: This is a strange hotel, it used to be the Blue Boy a sort of banquet and convention hotel for south Van. It has been taken over by Super 8 and the banquet rooms are empty. However, it is fairly clean and inexpensive, the makeover consists mostly of paint and carpet, but for Vancouver for a hotel on a bus route with parking I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “was blown out of bed by the air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Marlies000
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was placed about one metre from my bed and the wind coming from it blew me almost out of my bed, There were bloodstains in my bed: disgusting

Reviews.Title: “Be aware!!”
Reviews.Author: groovymomof3
Reviews.Content: We made reservations with Super 8. Upon calling back to change our reservation, we were informed of their no cancelation policy. We were not informed of this policy while making our reservation and feel that we were deceived given that almost all hotels allow for cancelations.

Reviews.Title: “We left early, we left quick.”
Reviews.Author: TravelWarrior05
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Here's a list of the problems I encountered: 1) They had to switch our room three times. The first room smelt like someone had lit 3 packs of cigarettes, the air conditioner didn't work, and the sheets hadn't been changed just made. The second room hadn't be cleaned and we checked in at 4PM. The third and final disappointing room had cob webs on the wall, mold growing all around the tub and the air conditioner was so loud you could hear it outside the room and looked as if it were from the 1980's. 2) In all three rooms the windows had no screens. So with the air conditioning not working you couldn't open a window either because of the bugs. 3) I'm not handicap but if you are stay away. The only way into the hotel from the parking is up or down stairs that lead to an elevator. 4) The hotel may tell you that there is a restaurant but there's not. In fact there is a bar that becomes a night club around 10 o clock at night. Oh, and there's a liquor store. This brings out very shady and scary people. 5) This hotel is in a horrible part of town. 6) We left early. When checking out we told the lady at the check out counter all the problems we encountered and she argued with us the entire time. She even told me that there were indeed screens on the windows as she snapped at me. And she told me that bugs can not fly to the fifth story. Basically, spending the extra 20-50 dollars to stay somewhere else is totally worth it. Staying here will be a huge mistake.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angiesays
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the quality inn on our way to the Dominican. We paid to park our van in there secured parking lot. The morning we left our van had been broken into, we were on our way to the airport and so had no time to deal with it, it's not going anywhere so we left for our two week holiday. When we got back our van was gone. They had it towed (probably didn't want it in the "secure parking" lot for everyone to see) we had to pay $600 to get it out of impound!! The quality inn did nothing to help us out including paying us back. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not by the airport, rooms not to any reasonable standard, not nice at all”
Reviews.Author: humantrends
Reviews.Content: Expedia told us it was close to the airport - well - a $20 taxi ride gets you there - almost to Burnaby. Strange people of the night around the hotel entrance and the taxi driver shaking his head in disbelief we were staying there. Staff friendly, but hotel very run down - walls with strange stains, bathroom ceiling with brown spots - bathtub stained, sink cracked and stained - torn wall paper, even a shower left us standing in ankle deep water - drain plugged with who knows what.. Obviously this is a fixer up hotel, and on our last night of vacation, what a nasty letdown - 5 star hotels and then this. What would you think of with such a disgusting bathroom - sleep didn't come, A one night Vancouver flight connection stay and never again! Shouldn't be called the airport inn as it is very misleading - not close to the airport at all.

Reviews.Title: “It is not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: Weissfrucht
Reviews.Content: It is easy to find hotel and get to airport with car. I stayed here only one night. You can get free parking, free internet, breakfast and good cleaned room. Staff are very friendly and give us good information. If you want to invest much time in hotel, this hotel is not good for you in Vancouver. If someone only want to get to airport, you can find here is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Unkempt, shabby and not somewhere you'll get a good sleep”
Reviews.Author: Am_health_inspector
Reviews.Content: One of worst places every stayed in! I stayed here at the beginning of Sept 2010 with my wife. The receptionist was unenthusiastic (at 10 pm.) and demanded $50 CD in case we damaged the room (not told about this in advance!). Wasn't comfortable to give them card details. Found room had ceiling held up by planks of wood, broken smoke alarm, dirty bathroom, cracks in ceiling and quite noisy so didn't get the sleep so desperately needed after long flight. Still trying to get refund. Breakfast was edible but not wide choice.

Reviews.Title: “lousy night's sleep and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: RenataJoy
Reviews.Content: The rooms look like they have been updated, but there are still ancient air conditioning units in the windows that do not work. Our rooms were ovens. The bar attached to the hotel attracts a tough looking clientele. We saw a man picking up a hooker while we were getting our rooms arranged. The next morning we forgot a special pillow at the hotel and when we called about it, we were told they would not mail it to us even if we would pay COD, or if we organized a courier. I just want the pillow back.

Reviews.Title: “Was easy to find and good value!”
Reviews.Author: rl_referre
Reviews.Content: Paid $59/night, easy to find and get to with/without a car. Get the skytrain and then a 2 min bus or drive straight down marine drive from airport. I have stayed here 3 times and every time I have had a good experience. I can't really see what people are complaining about. You get free parking, wireless, good breakfast, moderate sized rooms and the rooms are very clean. Staff have been friendly every time and they gave us a free ride to the airport upon request. There is a subway across the road and a Mcdonalds and Wendys not to far away on the same road. If you want value and your in Vancouver for a couple of day, this palce will do the trick....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ErikaWestkapelle
Reviews.Content: The recioptionists were very friendly and very willing to help you! there is a busstop naer the hotel to the station of the skytrain. Downtown en other highlights are very easy to reach. The room was a litte bit old but clean. The breakfast was good, but we missed cheese or ham.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zxcvbnmChicago
Reviews.Content: Look at youtube for this video: Airport Inn Vancouver or Quality Inn Airport, to see this hotel. This place is not what they tell you, nothing good in here, as soon as you get out from the elevator you feel a very strong smell like cigarette IN THE WHOLE PLACE, carpets are ugly ,dirty and old, the walls are falling down and the place look more like the cheaper motels that you see in bad movies, already inside in the room you will want to cry, smokey smell again, ugly room, dirty and old ,falling on pieces, one of the two beds had one leg missing, one bed had spots of blood on the blanket, the other blanket had cigarette burns all over, and BED BUGS!!! the carpet was dirty and with gum sticked, lots of wires exposed, old tv with some buttons missing, dirty toilet so was the bathtub, heater broke and not working, IMPORTANT: the windows have no locks! and that side of the street is dark and easy to somebody get into your room at the middle of the night, you feel like you will get kill any moment, next to the hotel there is a licor store, so you will see weird people all the time, take care, in the other side there is a bowling place with more weird people, next to the hotel there is a bar (wich used to be a striptease club)...weird people around all the time as well, DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY IN THIS PLACE, is dangerous, dirty and you will not want to use these dirty BED BUGS. Dont make the same mistake my brother and me made looking for the Olympic spirit in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Mcdonots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting and filthy. Terrible location with tons of drunks/druggies hang out. Customer Service/ Customer satisfaction is not sought. Pictures on this site are old, the place is a shambles even the flags on the poles are tattered now. On arrival we knew we had been fooled. We attempted to cancel our reservation immediately. Were told too bad so sad, our tough luck...and this was the manager. Wish we had read this site first. We used another online company to book and are trying to get the charge reversed note to others...we have since learned that that company does not check out any of the hotels they work with. Won't be using them again either.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Worst Hotels I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: travelon52
Reviews.Content: DO NOT EVER stay here. Nasty, Nasty, Nasty! Smelled like a dirty smokey room. And near the window, of all places, it smelled of urine. The toilet ran all night. And it was cold. It never warmed up. $70 for the night. Biggest rip off ever. DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Run By Crooks”
Reviews.Author: MaineFunTriper
Reviews.Content: Lead by the head crook Shamsher Singh Birring. This poor excuse for a hotel dropped its affiliation with quality hotels four months before the Olympics and left its patrons holding the bag. They saw it to be fare to forgo existing conformations and change its rates from $70 a night to $400 plus per night . Please do not support this business they are evil

Reviews.Title: “Olympic booking”
Reviews.Author: TerryHamilton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a week at this hotel for the olympics. We book the hotel about 5 months ago and received a rate of $139 per night. My husband received an email (how personal) to say that they sold the property and that now we would have to pay $500 a night if we want to keep the reservation. It is about 4 months to the olympics, probably the largest event in Canada and they are telling us now. The chain will not honor the rate at any nearby location, but they said they understand my pain!! So much for client service and client loyalty. I would like to call on anyone that is in the same position as we are and we need to take this to the senior management of this hotel chain. I feel sorry for the poor girl who has been deligated to take the fall and deal with all the angry clients while the "fanchise owners" make a big buck off all of us! These customers that have been taken by a reconginzed hotel chain who I am sure have benefited from getting the deal done, just before the Olympics as I am sure the new owners "Airport Inn" paid a premium to the hotel chain to ensure the deal was done in time to jack up the prices on the olympic fans who have already committed many dollars to the event, and cannot back out now! Wow, How about that Olympic Spirit!!! I will never book a room at anyone of these 2 chains. So much for the Canadian Olympic Spirit!

Reviews.Title: “nasty cheap hotel thank god i didnt have to pay”
Reviews.Author: xxsavviiixx
Reviews.Content: so basically we went to canada from california for a wedding and our so called relatives wanted to book us a hotel close to our so called uncle. so Quality inn was there choice from the outside it looked rather gross anf cheap but the lobby was nice and clean. Also i enjoyed having a garage to park cars but the room was abosuletly gross!!! i woke up with red bite marks on me and i looked at my dad and he had some on his face and so did everyone else. it was itching and gross. i read another reviwe under me and OMG! i cant believe it i got bite by a spider ew ewe wew gross. overral this hotel was gross!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality at Inn”
Reviews.Author: cmpYvr
Reviews.Content: Not a bad deal for getting the basics; I always ask for a quiet room being at the airport or near a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “It’s close from the airport & has free shuttle service. Recommended for transit travellers!”
Reviews.Author: gachen1
Reviews.Content: It’s close & easy to find from the airport & has shuttle service. Recommended for transit travelers. Don't expect too much & at $76.74 (including taxes & service fees) during late May, I suppose I received a decent & convenient place for the money. The nice thing about the Quality Inn Airpot is it’s close to the airport (15 minutes by shuttle) & the hotel provides free 24-hour shuttle service to & from the airport. The hotel also provide wake-up calls. Overall facilities are decent although I was a little disappointed the free internet wireless service in my room & hotel lobby didn’t work during my stay. Staffs were overall attentive although a few calls to the front desk at night were not answered straight away. I arrived late & menus from nearby eateries were available for delivery to my room. There were also some eateries within walking distance from the hotel. Traveler's tip: One must be careful though when calling the "Quality Inn Airport" in the shuttle-hotel phone directory area in the airport as there are 2 Quality Inn Airport hotels & both are about the same distance from the airport; know the address as that’s how you tell the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Gone seriously downhill in couple years. Inexpensive for a reason.”
Reviews.Author: CDickie
Reviews.Content: Flight was cancelled at last minute so had to overnight in Vancouver-being Choice Privileges member decided to stay near airport at best price. I had stayed here in 2004, just after renovations. I got what I paid for, and am surprised this is still a Quality Inn property. Pub/bar attached is seedy, restaurant closed so food only in pub- definitely not for families, mature travelers, or those expecting atmosphere. Pay the extra $20-40 dollars and stay at the QI Airport South, Executive Inn Airport or Airport Plaza, Travelodge Airport, Sandman Airport, Delta Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: dinkydog99
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I've ever stayed. The van from the airport should have been a clue. It was filthy on the outside and the inside was full of debris - wrappers, old cups, etc. The seats were even dirty. The room was run down and dirty, and not newly remodeled as AAA described. I had visions of bed bugs. The only place to get ice was in the bar as the two ice machines were broken. The remote didn't work. Overall it was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Scandalous things going on there.”
Reviews.Author: piguy420
Reviews.Content: It was relatively cheap for Vancouver, price-wise. The garage was secured, a little shady. The hallways seemed to be similar to the ones from the Shining. Our room came with a table, fridge, Queen size bed, telephone, crappy television set, and a large window. Very cramped room; restroom was surprisingly spacious. Next door neighbors were raping on some craked up crazy girl; heard screaming and banging on walls; no one seemed to care. Vancouver has some crazy crazy going on and you can find it at the Quality Inn Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Low Quality - you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: RockfishHunter
Reviews.Content: So we booked this place in a bit of an emergency when our flight to YVR was cancelled the following morning in anticipation of an ice storm and we needed to rush to the airport the night before and fly out. We barely made the flight, let alone had time to book some place. I found this on my blackberry on the way to the airport, it was cheap, near the vancouver airport and I figued it was part of the Choice chain so how bad could it be right? This place is truely a dump. I felt a bit unsafe here, as there were definitely hookers prowling around the place that the hotel "staff" did try to get rid of, but to no real effect. It's close to the airport, but the location is a bit seedy, with a pool hall adjacent to it. There are what look to be former conference rooms which are now more or less abandoned and filled with old broken furniture and vandalized. The underground parking is locked, so that was good. The "continental breakfast" leaves much to be desired, go to Tim Hortons instead. Honestly, for $50 a night, the room itself is fairly servicable, not the cleanest in the world but not the worst I've seen either. It's more the rest of the hotel that gives you the creeps. The attendant when we got there actually kinda smiled in a knowing way when we dragged our skis, etc into the lobby, probably figuring "these guys had no idea what they were getting into". Luckily we were only there for the night and pulled out the next day to head up to Whistler.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: bitride
Reviews.Content: Echoing what others have mentioned, this hotel is run-down, as you'd note from half the letters on the roof-level sign being burnt-out. Both available ice machines were broken, and one of the two drink vending machines (although I wouldn't be surprised if the other didn't work as well). Cleanliness was questionable. TV signal was noisy. The complimentary continental breakfast was the worst selection I've seen, and I blame what I did have for the stomache distress shortly afterward. Staff was ok, but with one person manning the front desk, I was kept waiting both during check-in and check-out. I've stayed in worse, but really can't think of anything good to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: irtman
Reviews.Content: I have been a frequent traveller for business and pleasure since the the mid-eighties and I can tell you that this was one of, if not the worst, hotels I have ever stayed in. I am only glad it was the one night. The staff was useless, hotel and rooms were filthy, smokey smelling, old and dingy. Whatever you do - DO NOT stay here! I am really surprised that Choice Hotels is associated with this hotel. I have had really good luck with choice hotels in the past, but this place has made me think twice about booking them since.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: timetotravel37
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via the CAA travel book. Our room was in really bad shape. Part the floorboards were falling off. The electrical outlet in the bathroom was falling off and looked unsafe. The bed was at least 20+ years old. The building is really run down. Contrary to the CAA add the rooms have not been renovated since 1970 probably. The only thing I can say is the shuttle to the airport was ok. The TV worked. I would say not worth it at all.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a DUMP! The not so "Quality" Inn”
Reviews.Author: HikerMark
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at front desk, I waited for at least 20 minutes for the attendant to check in the people in front of me. The phones for customer use at the front desk did not work. Attendant told me to drive to the parking garage gate and honk, he will open the gate, I did that, but had to wait for more than 5 minutes for the gate to open. The place overall is a dump, with the hotel needing serious cleaning and repairs. In our room (3rd floor), the sliding door which led to a balcony that was slightly higher than car parking, had the lock broken on it. Since this was a really shady looking neighborhood, and having a family with little kids, this did not feel safe. requested room change from 3rd to 5th floor. The room door to the hallway sagged, creating more than half inch gap at the top. The 5th floor hallway reeked of foul smoke, ice machine did not work. In general, if you are on a really tight budget and just need a place to crash this will work, but if you have a family and you're traveling to enjoy vancouver, don't even consider this place. We got out of this place after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card as was over priced”
Reviews.Author: kroswell
Reviews.Content: I am just adding to a previous review. Stayed at this hotel in January and you can read the previous review. Just wanted to add that when we got home and our visa bill came in we noticed a additonal charge on our visa of 199.00. I called the hotel and asked to speak to the manager and who's charge this was. They said they would look into it and would call me back. Well they did call me back and said they were sorry that I was mistakely billed someone else's bill along with my own???. They said they would credit my visa. Well I called visa and they said they would take care of it. The hotel never did credit my visa ( as of yet) and visa did adjust my bill for me. So just be carefull . I was also disappointed with quality inn themselves as I emailed them this information and they never responded. Shame on Quality Inn. This is my last stay at a Quality Inn.

Reviews.Title: “THird Booking”
Reviews.Author: ugogirl7
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that my husband and I (and a number of friends) have stayed at this hotel twice this in 2007 and I am about to book for December. We have not had any real problems and the price was excellent (standard room about $ 70 as we are seniors). The rooms are pleasant and clean (most have been recently renovated). The front desk guy was a bit testy but he was really busy. The service staff were perfect. The airport bus service was a half hour late and the driver from the Quality Hotel (a rival) said, "they always are". All in all, excellent value. Sorry to here about the problems experienced by other posters but it sure didn't happen to us.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: hurricane11
Reviews.Content: This property is terrible period.It does not have the same clean and welcoming feeling as other choice hotel properties. When we arrived if it had not been late we would have left and stayed somewhere else. In the end we should have left, as my wife was bitten no less than 15 times buy bed bugs. It subsuquently ruined her visit to Toronto. I talked to the manager Mr Gill and he asked that I send pics of the bites which I did with a letter requesting my wife be compensated for the medicine she bought in Toronto and also for the discomfort she went through . We got no reply from Mr gill. I called and left a message on two different occasions with my Phone number. He did not call back {we have call display and and answering machine].The 4th floor was eventually shut down. the whole place should be shut down. There wake up call machine didn t work either. This dump and it is a dump is not worthy of the choice hotels name. The lack of integrity in dealing with this issue is disgusting to say the least. One star is one to many for this place. DO NOT BOOK AT THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is SOOOOOO Terrible”
Reviews.Author: orcafans
Reviews.Content: We booked a double-bed room for the night of Aug 4th from the hotel's official website with the price $103.24. However, when we checked out on Aug 5th, the clerk at front desk charged us $114.84. We told him we were overcharged and showed him our reservation confirmation. He still insisted in charging the false amount of money and let us talk to the manager (She is not on duty that day). We emailed our situation to the manager later but the manager never gave us any reply. I highly do NOT recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Quality Control at Quality Inns”
Reviews.Author: MKAnderson
Reviews.Content: Booking with Choice Hotels is obviously no guarantee of quality. Paid close to $100.00 Canadian for a one night stay which would have been worth $45.00 or less on the prairies. When we arrived we had to wait in the lobby for nearly ten minutes because the front desk simply wasn't staffed. The clerk arrived back from a takeout place just before I was ready to conclude that the hotel didn't want my business. The hotel is older (not necessarily a disadvantage) but the upgrading is more in the nature of "tarting up" than a remodel. We arrived at our room to find an air conditioner that didn't work (leaving the room a sauna), the ice maker was out of commission and the pop machine ate my money. Secured locked parking was the only plus at this hotel. I would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The bare necessities at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jasonacg
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the hotel in 2002, based on its price, information gathered from the Internet, and its close proximity to the airport and airport shuttle (a plus for a first-time visitor to a new city). With mostly late-afternoon arrivals at the airport, my calls to the hotel result in a pick-up within 30 minutes. At the hotel, I have always found the staff to be attentive (and even after five years, some of the same staff still there). The hotel is not new, and it's not elegant by any means. However, the rooms are clean, and the amenities/level of service are adequate for the price of the room. I do like the fact that guest floor (3-6) access is restricted by room key, especially when there are a lot of non-guests on property (like when there used to be a casino on site--gone since 2005). Although the A/C units are window-mounted, it's not often that the Vancouver climate requires their use. I opened up the windows to enjoy the cool and dry air--a departure from my sticky Florida home. Having taken two trips with someone needing wheelchair accessibility, I found the facilities to be mostly easy to navigate. Reserved parking is scarce though (only three spaces up front, usually taken by those without parking permits), and the bathrooms may be a little small. Ask for an accessible room, but call **well in advance**--they only have 2 or 3 accessible rooms. There is secured parking, but one is advised to be careful with belongings in the car. Vancouver is a relatively safe city compared to other cities of the same size. But property crime is an epidemic, including auto theft/break-ins. It's not just this hotel--it's one of the few flaws that I've discovered citywide in my many trips there. If you don't need to rent a car, don't. This hotel sits immediately along two bus routes (100 is east/west with connections to YVR, 8 for more frequent north/south, and up to the downtown core). The system is efficient, reasonably clean and safe, and far-reaching. Save money on the rental car and spend $8 CDN on a day pass. hint...the Esso station across the street sells the passes, but it seems to be a well-kept secret. I choose to stay there year-after-year for the value and the staff. Although I could spend more on a hotel and get a more upscale decor, I stay here, spend less, and have extra spending money for the rest of my vacation. My main purpose of a hotel is to have a place to sleep and keep my stuff, and so a wealth of amenities is not important to me. As for food, it is limited on site, unless you like to laugh at (bad) multi-lingual karaoke. There's a White Spot about a 10-minute walk east (under a minute by car). Open late, and good quality food. Bottom line: It's not pretty, but it's adequate for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking!”
Reviews.Author: 1dottie
Reviews.Content: There was nothing positive about our stay at this hotel. The 24 hr. shuttle was the draw as our plane arrived at midnight, and that turned out to be a reimbursed taxi ride. When we phoned down to inquire about departure time for the shuttle in the a.m. we were told (in a manner that didn't even border on a pleasant customer service fashion ) that we had to book it the night before - however - no mention of it had been made when we booked in - even though we had arrived via that method! (or at least the fascimile of) Our reservation was down as being for 1 person instead of the 3 we had booked it for and we were told there wasn't a room to accommodate us - we'd have to get 2 rooms and pay for the extra room. When I said that wasn't acceptable, I was told that it wasn't the hotel's fault and to look at the computer screen - if I could see where it said 3 then we could have a room for 3 ! (but I thought there wasn't a room available?!? hmm) The 'continental' breakfast consisted of a few muffins and some donuts - in boxes - the breakfast special on the whiteboard, although not advertised with a price - was only for purchase. We ended up walking to a Timmies. So - if you need a place to stay close to the airport - keep looking!!! The Holiday Inn Express in Saskatoon is WONderful - chances are the one in Vanc. is as well - check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: CindyAHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: After several calls for a shuttle I was told to take a taxi & the hotel would pay for the ride. When we arrived @ the hotel, there was an argument between the taxi driver & front desk clerk about payment. I then decided to make my own arrangments to the cruise terminal as the hotel could not guarantee a shuttle in the morning. They advertise "newly decorated"...the decorations were outdated, the carpet in sveral places was "bunched up"..a tripping hazard. The A/C was a window unit. We had to wait for a breakfast table, as the resturant is too small. They will not standby the 100% satisfaction guarantee. I contacted the corporate office & they just refered me back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice newly renovated friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay as I have been going there for several years. I think that this hotel has made a HUGE improvment and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would really recommend this hotel as I have seen the changes that it has made. This hotel is like a second home where I know that I can relax.

Reviews.Title: “scary, scummy place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place doesn't live up to even the most basic standards of a Quality Inn chain (no less any other decent hotel), and should lose its franchise. It is in an old building (a casino in its heyday) that is worn down and in an unattractive neighborhood. There seemed to be people living there by the month. There were drunks begging right outside, probably because there is a liquor store in a storefront downstairs. The lobby was dirty and dingy, and the desk clerk was alone and couldn't keep up with the calls and kept telling callers to call the national reservation line. He kept us waiting for help on more than one occasion. The elevators worked irregularly. Our fifth floor room was fair, but there were no locks on the windows and there was a metal "catwalk" going right by it. Neighbors could have easily crawled out of their room and into ours. When we expressed our concerns to the front desk clerk, he brushed us off. Yuck! I would never stay there again! A depressing place!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, creepy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it offered fourteen days of free parking for airport travelers. After one night, even though we are frugal (read, "pretty darn cheap"), we decided it was worthwhile to pay airport parking prices for ten days so the car would be safe and we wouldn't have to return to the hotel. I would never stay here again. The underground parking was scary; the above-ground parking eerily deserted. It was an unsavory crowd streaming into the package store and around the front of the hotel. Everything smelled of urine. Although I've willingly stayed at many a cheap motel, I've never seen one this dirty. There were dirty linens dropped on the floor of the room when we opened the door, and I'm not positive the bed linens had been changed. The dining area for the complimentary continental breakfast had ground-in crumbs on the floor: it looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in a month, and the corn flakes tasted like they'd been sitting out at least that long. And, to top it off, it wasn't particularly close to the airport! I would definitely advise against this place.

Reviews.Title: “Need to increase my travel budget...”
Reviews.Author: tinadam
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel 2 stars because it was inexpensive, and that was the main reason I booked it. In retrospect, what a mistake... The hotel seems like it's falling apart. The staff is nice and friendly enough, but I have to say it's one of the worst hotels I've stayed in, and I've stayed in some bad ones. First off, there's a liquor store and bowling alley, with a bunch of "hanging out at liquor store" type people hanging out in front of the building. Not a great feature. Second, the underground parking lot is pretty scary. It's dark, not secured, and only connected to the hotel via the gutted casino, which itself is a dark, gloomy place. They have an aboveground parking deck, but I was advised by hotel staff that it might not be good idea to park there. The hotel decor is worn and old, and the room had a very musty smell which kept my wife up most of the night. Since this experience I've decided to increase my hotel allowance by about $20-30 per night-- it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: COtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we arrived at YVR late and wanted a one night economy hotel before heading into town for a week. However, the environment at the Quality Inn would have us looking for another location on our next pass. ***Careful that there are TWO Quality Inns on the YVR international terminal hotel call board*** The hotel shuttle took 30 minutes to arrive (even after several calls to front desk) and then about 15 more mintues en route. The hotel did not have curb appeal, it's interior was outdated and smelled of cigarette smoke and age. I assume the lobby is under renovation from the other posts, but there was no indication of work taking place. The elevators were locked by room key, but the area surrounding the hotel was less than inviting on our Friday night stay. There were several restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel -- and an Indian restaurant immediately across the street. The hotel has a bar and was hosting (bad) karyoke upon our arrival (open til ~1AM). The bright spot of the stay was our room. It was ok -- the bed coverings were aged and the bathroom was dated and had some mold in the shower. No central air -- window units for the AC which worked fine. Plenty of storage space and in-room coffee. The complementary breakfast was ok as well. There was a fine assortment of choices and the service was very good and welcoming. The other guests seemed to be an older, camper traveling crowd from what I could tell. We called a taxi from the front desk and one arrived within 5 minutes to take us to our next stop in downtown Vancouver (20 minutes = C$20 ride).

Reviews.Title: “I like the new direction”
Reviews.Author: wineries
Reviews.Content: Wow it seems that either this hotel either its big or does not hit at all. well for me this hotel hits big. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood near the airport. I also saw this hotel is under alot of rennovations, especially the front lobby, which is good. Out is the casino, in is meeting space. Free Internet, fridge and microwave in my room, is what I like to see. I too stayed in their business room. The service, I had no complaints, and I can see that the hotel is changing more into a business-leisure hotel. Choice Hotels isn't known for being business-leisure, but I do like the changes that are being made, and the new direction that they are going.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sonics
Reviews.Content: To the point, I don't prepay. I pay for a certain level of service, and this hotel came through. You never know what to expect when you stay at a Choice Property. I felt good about staying here. I stayed in one of their new business rooms, and was treated the way that I like to be treated. Hot breakfast, free internet, free faxing are just a few things I enjoyed. I thought the business stationary showed creativity. My room had a good feel to it. The service was decent, and my overall stay was good. I stayed for a week here and I'll do it again. Lamb chops was good. I'll be back. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Not so rosey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel late July this year. If you just want a place to sleep, it would do. It is a very old refurbished hotel in an old neighborhood. I don't know where the restaurants the previous reviewer mentioned were as the clerk only mentioned one possibilty a couple of blocks away. I would not consider walking there. There was a small eating space in the lobby. Very limited menu. It is connected to a gambling casino and a sports bar. The air conditioning was an old and very noisey window unit which had to be turned off to sleep. The elevator floor indicators were not readable and there was no emergency alert in it. The room was clean, bed fair. The clerk was pleasant enough. I had to remind her that I had prepaid for the room. Fortuantely, I had kept my receipt. It is about five miles from the airport. They have a shuttle. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband had occassion to stay with you on May 23rd and May 31st this year. We were leaving on a Princess cruise and searched for a reasonably priced property near the airport that offered an airport shuttle. We found you from a AAA guide. We greatly appreciated your desk person, but I regret that I have misplaced her name. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. You had everything that we needed in one place including several good restaurants nearby. We enjoyed drinks and chicken wings in the lounge on our first night. Breakfast was a treat and the young lady who served us was a pleasure. When we returned from our trip, our plane had been delayed so we were even later and more tired than we expected. The front desk person took our call at midnight, instructed us on how to take a taxi to the hotel and promptly reimbursed us for the cost of the taxi. She checked us in rapidly and even had our requested two extra pillows on our bed before we got to our room. We had a great rest, another nice breakfast and were helped to get a taxi to take us to our car parked near the dock. We just wanted to let you know that the facility, service, food and staff were all a delight. We have recommended this hotel to our travel agent for people who need lodging in Vancouver and will certainly use the hotel again if we have the opportunity to visit your beautiful city again.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8
HotelInfo.Address: 725 SE Marine Dirve, Vancouver, British Columbia V5X 2T9, Canada
